quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Multidimensional Arrays[/h1]

You can get and set a multidimensional array's elements using the same pair of square brackets.
[b]Example:[/b] [code format="java" codeId="751"]int[ ][ ] myArr = { {1, 2, 3}, {4}, {5, 6, 7} };
myArr[0][2] = 42;
int x = myArr[1][0]; // 4[/code]
The above two-dimensional array contains three arrays. The first array has three elements, the second has a single element and the last of these has three elements. 
[note]In Java, you're not limited to just two-dimensional arrays. Arrays can be nested within arrays to as many levels as your program needs. All you need to declare an array with more than two dimensions, is to add as many sets of empty brackets as you need. However, these are harder to maintain.
Remember, that all array members must be of the same type.[/note]
